tooltips.desc: The precise time of the song shown in seconds.
tooltips.hint: Scroll or type in it to change the time.

tooltips.desc: The playback speed of the level.
tooltips.hint: This can be used for seeing animations at slow motion to get a better look at them.

tooltips.desc: Which layer of the editor timeline you're viewing.
tooltips.hint: Scroll on the input field to quickly change between layers or type a number in it to go to that layer. You can also click on the scrollwheel while hovering over it to show a list of layers that have objects.

tooltips.desc: <font=Angsana>Which of the seven seas of me treasure ye be lookin' at.
tooltips.hint: Roll down ye barrel of rum for embarking down the many realms of the 7 seas. Shoot ye firearm at ye barrel of rum to unleash the booty.

tooltips.desc: A level from your editor folder.
tooltips.hint: Left click to open the level and right click to show the context menu.

tooltips.desc: Opens the level in the editor.
tooltips.hint: Left click to open the level.

tooltips.desc: Opens the level autosaves / backups list.
tooltips.hint: Left click to open the autosaves / backups list, where you can select a file to open it in the editor or change from autosave to backup or back.
Left click to open this folder and set it as the current editor folder your levels are loaded from.
Left click to open the Folder Creator. The new folder will end up in the current editor folder.
Left click to open the Level Template Editor.
Left click to open the New Level Creator.

tooltips.desc: Creates a backup of the level.
tooltips.hint: Left click to save a backup. You can access it by going to Show Autosaves.
Left click to open the Folder Renamer.
Left click to open the Level Renamer. Renaming the level will rename both the folder of the level and the level name itself.
When the level is pasted, it will be moved to the new location instead of being duplicated.
When the level is pasted, it will be duplicated. If the level already exists in the current editor folder, the level folder will be renamed.
If you have copied / cut a level, left click to paste it into the current editor folder.
Permenantly deletes the level. Only do this if you're 100% sure you want to delete it. Always make sure you have backups!

tooltips.desc: ZIP the folders' contents into a .zip file.
tooltips.hint: Creates a .zip file and copies the contents of the folder into it.

tooltips.desc: Copies the path of the folder.
tooltips.hint: Takes the full path to the level / folder and puts it onto your clipboard.

tooltips.desc: Opens the folder in file explorer.
tooltips.hint: Starts the local file explorer and opens the folder in it.

tooltips.desc: Opens the current editor folder in file explorer.
tooltips.hint: Starts the local file explorer and opens the current editor folder in it.

tooltips.desc: Toggles if the file is an autosave or a backup.
tooltips.hint: Autosaves are automatically deleted if the files reach the autosave cap, whereas backups are not deleted.

tooltips.desc: Copies the Arcade ID of the level.
tooltips.hint: Takes the Arcade ID of the level and puts it onto your clipboard.

tooltips.desc: Copies the Server ID of the level.
tooltips.hint: If the level was uploaded, takes the Server ID of the level and puts it onto your clipboard.

tooltips.desc: Converts the level to the VG format.
tooltips.hint: The VG format is the format modern versions of Project Arrhythmia use.

tooltips.desc: Converts the level to the LS format.
tooltips.hint: The LS format is the format Legacy versions of Project Arrhythmia use.

tooltips.desc: Players will need to play the level in a specific version of BetterLegacy.
tooltips.hint: This is for cases where a level was made in a version with specific features that either work differently in other versions or don't exist anymore.

tooltips.desc: If Require Version is on, then this specifies how the levels' version should be compared to the games' version.
tooltips.hint:
Less Than: Level is only playable before and in the version the level was saved in. This is for cases where there's a removed feature or something has changed significantly.
Equal To: Level is only playable in a specific version. Just in case a feature only exists in this version, for whatever reason.
Greater Than: Level is only playable after and in the version the level was saved in. This is for newer features that don't exist in older versions.

tooltips.desc: Upload a level to the custom arcade server.
tooltips.hint: If you aren't already logged in, you will be requested to do so before uploading again.

tooltips.desc: The physical behavior of the object.
tooltips.hint: Normal: Damages the player and is opaque by default. Helper: Does not damage the player and has 0.35 opacity. Recommended for warning attacks. Decoration: Does not damage the player. Empty: Does not spawn any visual object. Recommended for parenting. Solid: Does not allow the player to pass through it.

tooltips.desc: The despawn behavior of the object.
tooltips.hint: No Autokill: Object does not despawn. Recommended for persistent objects. Last Keyframe: Despawns as soon as the objects' animation is finished. Last Keyframe Offset: Despawns at an offset from the end of the objects' animation. Fixed Time: Despawns at a specific time from the start time, regardless of keyframes. Song Time: Despawns at song time, regardless of start time.

tooltips.desc: A prefab from your prefabs folder.
tooltips.hint: Left click to open the External Prefab window, or if your Import Prefabs Directly setting is on, to import the prefab directly into your level. You can also right click to show the context menu for External Prefabs.

tooltips.desc: A prefab from the level itself.
tooltips.hint: Left click to add the Prefab to the level as a Prefab Object. You can also assign this as a Quick Prefab by selecting the Quick Prefab button below and selecting this Prefab.

tooltips.desc: Exports an internal prefab to your prefabs folder.
tooltips.hint: The prefab gets exported and saved to the current prefabs folder.

tooltips.desc: The despawn behavior of the Prefab Object. Objects that despawn before the despawn point of the Prefab Object are not affected.
tooltips.hint: Regular: Does not change the autokill behavior of any spawned objects. Start Time: Objects alive past a specific time from the start time will despawn. Song Time: Objects alive past a specific time will despawn.

tooltips.desc: Copies the currently selected Prefab Objects' data.
tooltips.hint: Imported Prefabs will have the copied data pasted to it automatically.

tooltips.desc: Pastes the copied instance data to the currently selected Prefab Object.
tooltips.hint: Imported Prefabs will have the copied data pasted to it automatically.
Imported Prefabs will have the copied data pasted to it automatically. Removing the copied data will stop this.

tooltips.desc: A theme from your themes folder.
tooltips.hint: Left click to import the theme into the level. You can also right click to show the context menu for External Themes.
Left click to use the theme on the selected keyframe. You can also right click to show the context menu for Internal Themes.

tooltips.desc: Imports an external theme into the level.
tooltips.hint: The theme will be saved and used in the level file.

tooltips.desc: Finds a theme with the same ID in the level and overwrites it.
tooltips.hint: The theme will be saved and used in the level file. Does not import the theme if no theme was found.

tooltips.desc: Exports an internal theme to your themes folder.
tooltips.hint: The theme gets exported and saved to the current themes folder.

tooltips.desc: Removes all themes that aren't used by any theme keyframes from the level.
tooltips.hint: Themes that are unused will be removed.

tooltips.desc: The order the level panels appear in.
tooltips.hint:
Cover Sort by if level has a set cover. (Default)
Artist Sort by song artist.
Creator Sort by level creator.
Folder Sort by level folder name.
Title Sort by song title.
Difficulty Sort by level difficulty.
Date Edited Sort by date edited.
Date Created Sort by date created.
Left click to toggle. If on, the level sort will ascend.

tooltips.desc: The editor directory in your beatmaps folder.
tooltips.hint: Type in the field to change where your levels are loaded from. Right click the field to open a quick folder selection.

tooltips.desc: The prefabs directory in your beatmaps folder.
tooltips.hint: Type in the field to change where your prefabs are loaded from. Right click the field to open a quick folder selection.

tooltips.desc: The prefab folder that gets loaded whenever you enter this level.
tooltips.hint: If the levels' default prefab folder was not set, then it'll keep the currently set folder. This is for QOL changing of prefab lists for different levels.

tooltips.desc: The themes directory in your beatmaps folder.
tooltips.hint: Type in the field to change where your themes are loaded from. Right click the field to open a quick folder selection.

tooltips.desc: The theme folder that gets loaded whenever you enter this level.
tooltips.hint: If the levels' default theme folder was not set, then it'll keep the currently set folder. This is for QOL changing of themes for different levels.

tooltips.desc: Runs the animation when the associated action occurs.
tooltips.hint: When an action runs, it searches for animations with a specific reference ID and plays it (e.g. reference ID is set to boost and the player boosts, the animation will play). This can be right clicked to show the list of default references.

tooltips.desc: If the first keyframes of the animation should use the current objects' values instead of the keyframes.
tooltips.hint: First keyframes will be replaced at runtime with the position, scale, etc. values of the object.
Left click to expand the object modifiers list.

tooltips.desc: If the order of the modifiers matters.
tooltips.hint: With Order Matters off, all action modifiers require all trigger modifiers to be triggered With it on, action modifiers only care about triggers before itself and not before other actions. This can be good for simplifying your levels' modifier setup.

tooltips.desc: If the modifiers in the object can activate regardless of the objects' lifespan.
tooltips.hint: With Ignore Lifespan off, modifiers will only activate / trigger when the object spawns.

tooltips.desc: Objects store a single number that can be referenced by other objects or by itself.
tooltips.hint: This can be used by several modifiers that can check the objects' variable. Useful for in-game selection systems.
Opens the modifier list where you can choose a modifier to add to the object.
If a modifier was copied, this pastes it to the current object.

tooltips.desc: Deletes the modifier from the object
tooltips.hint: Removes the modifier and triggers its inactive state.
Shortens the modifier to just the name and main settings.
This allows you to have a copy of the modifier with the exact values. Once you copy the modifier, a "Paste" button will appear.
With this on, the modifier runs every frame, otherwise the modifier runs only once.

tooltips.desc: Modifier runs a set amount of times
tooltips.hint: With this on, the modifier will only run a set amount of times. If the count is 0, it will continue running.

tooltips.desc: Trigger runs if previous triggers weren't active.
tooltips.hint: Makes the trigger an "Or Gate".

tooltips.desc: Trigger runs if the result is the opposite.
tooltips.hint: Makes the trigger a "Not Gate".

tooltips.desc: If the modifier should only search for objects that have the same prefab instance reference. Includes both spawned and expanded objects.
tooltips.hint: Searches for prefab instance objects.

tooltips.desc: If the modifier should search for objects that are currently alive.
tooltips.hint: Searches for alive objects.

tooltips.desc: If the modifier should search for objects spawned from the prefab.
tooltips.hint: Searches the spawned prefab.

tooltips.desc: Lights up when the modifier is running.
tooltips.hint: If the modifier is running, the notifier will light up.
Breaks the current trigger check.
Prevents all modifiers from running. Useful for debugging.
Allows all modifiers to re-activate.

Runs the next sequence of modifiers a set amount of times, with an index variable passed to each sequence. The 'return' modifier can be used to stop the loop or skip it entirely if triggers before the forLoop modifiers weren't triggered.
Continues to the next modifier loop.
Stops the modifier loop from continuing.
Trigger is active after a specified amount of time.
Trigger is active after a set counter exceeds the range.

If the modifier is in a set of triggers, invert the current trigger check. Otherwise if the trigger is after a set of action modifiers, the next set of action modifiers will only run if the previous triggers weren't triggered.
Inverts the current trigger check (True becomes False, False becomes True).
Gives a brief description on a set of modifiers.
Gets a toggle value and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets a float value and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets an int value and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets a string (text) value and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets a string (text) value, converts it to lowercase and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets a string (text) value, converts it to uppercase and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets a custom enum value and passes it to other modifiers. You can edit the enum values.
Gets an interpolated event value and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets an audio sample value and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the objects' text value and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets another objects' text value and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the currently held key and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets a string value from a saved JSON file in the profiles folder and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets a float value from a saved JSON file in the profiles folder and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets a JSON value and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the substring of a string (text) value and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets a string (text) value, splits it by a specified character and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets a string (text) value, splits it by a specified character, gets a specific value at an index and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets a string (text) value, splits it by a specified character, gets the amount of splits and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the length of a string (text) value and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets a regex match and passes it to other modifiers. Each match group can be assigned to a variable, including the whole match.
Gets a formatted string and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets a true or false value if two text values match and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets a true or false value if two evaluated math values match and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the objects' editor bin value and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the objects' editor layer value and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the objects' name value and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets variables sent to this modifier via signalLocalVariables and passes it to other modifiers.
Sends the current variables to a group of objects.
Clears the current stored variables from the modifier runtime.
Stores the current variables to this modifier and passes them after modifier activation. Good for cases where you only want to get a variable once.
Trigger is active if a local modifier variable is equal to the modifier value.
Trigger is active if a local modifier variable is equal to or lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if a local modifier variable is equal to or greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if a local modifier variable is lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if a local modifier variable is greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if a local modifier variable contains the modifier value.
Trigger is active if a local modifier variable contains the modifier value.
Trigger is active if a local modifier variable contains the modifier value.
Trigger is active if a local modifier variable exists with the matching modifier value.
Adds an amount to the objects' variable.
Adds an amount to a group of object's variables.
Subtracts an amount to the objects' variable.
Subtracts an amount to a group of object's variables.
Sets an amount to the objects' variable.
Sets an amount to a group of object's variables.
Sets a random range to the object's variable.
Sets a random range to a group of object's variables.
Loads and applies a variable from a profile file.
Loads and applies a variable to a group of objects from a profile file.
Takes an axis of another object and applies it to the object variable.
Forces the object variable to stay within a set range.
Forces a group of object's variables to stay within a set range.
Trigger is active if the object variable is equal to the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the object variable is equal to or lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the object variable is equal to or greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the object variable is lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the object variable is greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if a different object's variable is equal to the modifier value.
Trigger is active if a different object's variable is equal to or lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if a different object's variable is equal to or greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if a different object's variable is lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if a different object's variable is greater than the modifier value.
Gets the current audio pitch and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the current audio time and passes it to other modifiers.
Sets the song pitch (level speed) multiplied by the audio event keyframe's pitch value.
Adds to the song pitch (level speed) multiplied by the audio event keyframe's pitch value.
Sets the song pitch (level speed) multiplied by the audio event keyframe's pitch value. Uses a math calculation instead of just parsing the number.
Adds to the song pitch (level speed) multiplied by the audio event keyframe's pitch value. Uses a math calculation instead of just parsing the number.
Sets the song time. Recommended for skipping specific parts of a level / song.
Sets the song time using a math equation. Recommended for skipping specific parts of a level / song.
Sets the song time to where the object spawns. Don't use this by itself, instead include a modifier that will trigger it.
Sets the song time to where the object despawns. Good for skipping a section.
Sets the currently playing state of the song.
Plays a sound located in the level folder or a soundlibrary folder in the beatmaps folder. (soundlibrary is only recommended for offline levels)
Plays an online sound.
Plays a sound located in the game files.
Works like the playSound modifier, except it aligns the sound time with the music time relative to when the object spawns. Scale X and Y can be used to animate pitch and volume respectively.
Loads audio clip data of a sound asset.
Trigger is active if the song pitch (level speed) is equal to the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the song pitch (level speed) is equal to or lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the song pitch (level speed) is equal to or greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the song pitch (level speed) is lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the song pitch (level speed) is greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if audio time is greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if audio time is lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if audio is playing.
Makes the visual object's position react to the music.
Makes the visual object's scale react to the music.
Makes the visual object's rotation react to the music.
Makes the visual object's color react to the music. Reactive color adds to the object's current color.
Makes the visual object's color react to the music. Reactive color interpolates from the object's current color to the set color.
Makes the object's position react to the music. Works with parenting.
Makes the object's scale react to the music. Works with parenting.
Makes the object's rotation react to the music. Works with parenting.
Makes the background object's fade iterations react to the music.
Loads a level by its folder name and plays it. Only use for sandboxing purposes, as levels shared through the arcade server or a different service could have a different folder name.
Finds a level with a matching arcade ID and plays it. Can be used in both editor and arcade. The level must be loaded in the editor / arcade list.
Loads a level by its folder name within the current level folder and plays it. This modifier is for cases where you have a level located inside another level.
Loads the previously loaded level, if there was any.
Loads the current hub level, if the player ever entered one during the current play session. (Play session includes from when the player enters the first level to when they return to the arcade)
Finds a level with a matching arcade ID within the current level collection and plays it. Only works in the arcade. A level collection must be loaded.
Finds a level collection and loads a level from it.
Finds a level with a matching arcade ID and plays it. If the level was not found, prompt the player to download it with the confirm menu. Only works in the arcade.
Forces the end level screen to occur. For cases where you want to end the level differently from the regular way.
Sets the audio transition for the next loaded level.
Sets the intro fade for the next loaded level.
Sets the function that is run when the level ends. If the function is kept to default, the current function doesn't change.
Gets the levels' ID and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the levels' name and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the levels' current rank and passes it to other modifiers.
Trigger is active if the current level's rank is equal to the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the current level's rank is equal to or lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the current level's rank is equal to or greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the current level's rank is lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the current level's rank is greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if a different level's rank is equal to the modifier value.
Trigger is active if a different level's rank is equal to or lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if a different level's rank is equal to or greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if a different level's rank is lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if a different level's rank is greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the calculated level rank is equal to the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the calculated level rank is equal to or lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the calculated level rank is equal to or greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the calculated level rank is lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the calculated level rank is greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if a level with the matching ID is unlocked.
Trigger is active if the current level is unlocked.
Trigger is active if a different level is unlocked.
Trigger is active if a level is in the user's local levels list.
Trigger is active if a level exists in the user's ocal level folder.
Unlocks an achievement.
Unlocks an achievement.
Saves the current level rank.
Clears the hit counter, marking the current Level Rank as SS rank.
Adds to the hit counter.
Subtracts from the hit counter.
Clears the death counter.
Adds to the death counter.
Subtracts from the death counter.
Gets a custom variable stored in a levels' save data.
Sets a custom variable stored in a levels' save data.
Removes a custom variable stored in a levels' save data.
Clears all custom variables stored in a levels' save data.
Gets a custom variable stored in the current levels' save data.
Sets a custom variable stored in the current levels' save data.
Removes a custom variable stored in the current levels' save data.
Clears all custom variables stored in the current levels' save data.
Trigger is active if game is in zen mode.
Trigger is active if game is in normal mode.
Trigger is active if game is in 1 life mode.
Trigger is active if game is in 1 hit mode.
Trigger is active if game is in practice mode.
Trigger is active if the user is in the editor.
Trigger is active if the user is in the editor and is editing.
Changes the object's material to a blur. Can be animated with opacity if it is turned on.
Changes all objects in a group's material to a blur. Can be animated with opacity if it is turned on.
Changes the object's material to a blur, set via the object variable.
Changes all objects in a group's material to a blur, set via the object variables.
Changes the object's material to a colored blur. Can be animated with opacity if it is turned on.
Changes all objects in a group's material to a colored blur. Can be animated with opacity if it is turned on.
Changes the object's material to a material that allows the object to be seen from the back.
Makes the object emit particles.
Makes the object emit particles.
Makes the object leave behind a trail when it moves.
Makes the object leave behind a trail when it moves. Allows for hex color codes.
Gives the visual object a Rigididbody2D component, allowing for other objects to detect colliion from this one. Gravity does not work with parenting.
Gives a group of visual objects a Rigididbody2D component, allowing for other objects to detect colliion from this one. Gravity does not work with parenting.
Sets the objects' render type.
Sets a group of objects' render type.
Sets the objects' render settings.
Applies an outline to the object.
Applies an outline to a group of objects.
Applies an outline to a group of objects.
Sets the fade iteration offset for the background object.
Gets the index of the player nearest to the object and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the a true of false value of all players colliding with the object and passes it to other modifiers. Each player is assigned to the variable name + _index.
Gets the health of a player at an index and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the lives count of a player at an index and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the x position of a player at an index and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the y position of a player at an index and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the rotation of a player at an index and passes it to other modifiers.
Trigger is active if the object is colliding with the player.
Trigger is active if the object is colliding with the specified player at the index.
Trigger is active if any object in a group is colliding with the player.
Trigger is active if any object in a group is colliding with the specified player at the index.
Trigger is active if any player's health is equal to the modifier value.
Trigger is active if any player's health is equal to or lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if any player's health is equal to or greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if any player's health is lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if any player's health is greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the global death count is equal to the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the global death count is equal to or lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the global death count is equal to or greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the global death count is lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the global death count is greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the boost count is equal to the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the boost count is equal to or lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the boost count is equal to or greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the boost count is lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the boost count is greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the total player count is equal to the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the total player count is equal to or lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the total player count is equal to or greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the total player count is lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if the total player count is greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if any player is moving.
Trigger is active if the closest player to the object is boosting.
Trigger is active if the player at an index is boosting.
Trigger is active if the closest player to the object is jumping.
Trigger is active if the player at an index is jumping.
Trigger is active if the closest player to the object is alive.
Trigger is active if the player at an index is alive.
Trigger is active if all players are alive.
Trigger is active if the closest player to the object is activating an input.
Trigger is active if the player at an index is activating an input.
Trigger is active if any player is outside the range of the object.
Trigger is active if any player is inside the range of the object.
Trigger is active if a player was hit.
Trigger is active if a player died.
Trigger is active if a player boosted.
Trigger is active if a player jumped.
Heals the player closest to the object.
Heals the player at an index.
Heals all players.
Hits the player closest to the object.
Hits the player at an index.
Hits all players.
Kills the player closest to the object.
Kills the player at an index.
Kills all players.
Respawns the player closest to the object.
Respawns the player at an index.
Respawns all players.
Enables the player closest to the object.
Enables the player at an index.
Enables all players.
Moves the player closest to the object along both the X and Y axis.
Moves a player at an index along both the X and Y axis.
Moves all players along both the X and Y axis.
Moves the player closest to the object along the X axis.
Moves a player at an index along the X axis.
Moves all players along the X axis.
Moves the player closest to the object along the Y axis.
Moves a player at an index along the Y axis.
Moves all players along the Y axis.
Rotates the player closest to the object.
Rotates a player at an index.
Rotates all players.
Moves the player closest to the object along both the X and Y axis and locks the position to the object's position.
Moves the player at an index along both the X and Y axis and locks the position to the object's position.
Moves all players along both the X and Y axis and locks the position to the object's position.
Moves the player closest to the object along the X axis and locks the position to the object's position.
Moves the player at an index along the X axis and locks the position to the object's position.
Moves all players along the X axis and locks the position to the object's position.
Moves the player closest to the object along the Y axis and locks the position to the object's position.
Moves the player at an index along the Y axis and locks the position to the object's position.
Moves all players along the Y axis and locks the position to the object's position.
Rotates the player closest to the object and locks the rotation to the object's rotation.
Rotates the player at an index and locks the rotation to the object's rotation.
Rotates all players and locks the rotation to the object's rotation.
Drags the player closest to the object around with the object, but allows the player free movement.
Forces the player closest to the object to boost.
Forces the player at an index to boost.
Forces all players to boost.
Forces the player closest to the object to cancel the current boost.
Forces the player at an index to cancel the current boost.
Forces all players to cancel their current boost.
Prevents the player closest to the object from boosting.
Prevents the player at an index from boosting.
Prevents all players from boosting.
Allows the player closest to the object to boost.
Allows the player at an index to boost.
Allows all players to boost.
Allows the player closest to the object to move and rotate.
Allows the player at an index to move and rotate.
Allows all players to move and rotate.
Sets the global speed of all players.
Sets velocity of all players along both the X and Y axis.
Sets velocity of all players along the X axis.
Sets velocity of all players along the Y axis.
Allows the player closest to the object to take damage.
Allows the player at an index to take damage.
Allows all players to take damage.
Allows the player closest to the object to jump.
Allows the player at an index to jump.
Allows all players to jump.
Allows the player closest to the object to jump while upside down.
Allows the player at an index to jump while upside down.
Allows all players to jump while upside down.
Allows the player closest to the object to jump on walls.
Allows the player at an index to jump on walls.
Allows all players to jump on walls.
Sets the jump gravity of the player closest to the object.
Sets the jump gravity of the player at an index.
Sets the jump gravity of all players.
Sets the jump intensity of the player closest to the object.
Sets the jump intensity of the player at an index.
Sets the jump intensity of all players.
Sets the current gamemode of the level.
Sets the current gamemode of the level. This modifier is deprecated, use setGameMode instead.
Sets a specified player's player model.
Pulls the nearest player towards the center of the object.
Pulls a player at an index towards the center of the object.
Pulls all players towards the center of the object.
Pushes the nearest player away from the center of the object.
Pushes a player at an index away from the center of the object.
Pushes all players away from the center of the object.
Shows the mouse cursor. Normally the mouse is disabled in levels, but it can be re-enabled for cases where you want mouse interaction.
Hides the mouse cursor.
Sets the mouse position relative to the Window.
Makes the object follow the mouse.
Trigger is active if a specific key was pressed.
Trigger is active if a specific key is being pressed.
Trigger is active if a specific key was released.
Trigger is active if a specific controller button was pressed.
Trigger is active if a specific controller button is being pressed.
Trigger is active if a specific controller button was released.
Trigger is active if a specific mouse button was pressed.
Trigger is active if a specific mouse button is being pressed.
Trigger is active if a specific mouse button was released.
Trigger is active if the mouse is over the object.
Trigger is active if the mouse is over the object. If it is active, send a signal to a group of objects that must have a requireSignal modifier.
Trigger is active if a player bullet is colliding with the object.
Trigger is active if the object is colliding with an object that has a matching tag and has a rigidbody modifier.
Turns the collision on or off.
Turns the collision of a group of objects on or off.

Enables the visual object.
Inactive condition: Disables.

Enables the entire parent tree.
Inactive condition: Disables.

Enables the visuals of a group of objects.
Inactive condition: Disables.

Enables the entire parent tree of a group of objects.
Inactive condition: Disables.

Enables multiple groups of objects depending on the state. If 'State' is set to 'All' then all groups will be enabled / disabled the same. If the state was set to one of the groups, that group will be selected as the enabled / disabled group and all other groups will have the opposite active state.

Disables the visual object.
Inactive condition: Enables.

Disables the entire parent tree.
Inactive condition: Enables.

Disables the visuals of a group of objects.
Inactive condition: Enables.

Disables the entire parent tree of a group of objects.
Inactive condition: Enables.
Sets a group of Background Objects active / inactive.
Saves a floating point number (like 0.4324) to a JSON file that can be read later.
Saves a string (like "hi") to a JSON file that can be read later.
Saves the text of the text object to a JSON file that can be read later.
Saves the variable of the object to a JSON file that can be read later.
Trigger is active if a JSON value is equal to the modifier value. Supports text and numbers.
Trigger is active if a JSON value is equal to or lesser than the modifier value. Supports only numbers.
Trigger is active if a JSON value is equal to or greater than the modifier value. Supports only numbers.
Trigger is active if a JSON value is lesser than the modifier value. Supports only numbers.
Trigger is active if a JSON value is greater than the modifier value. Supports only numbers.
Trigger is active if a JSON value exists.

Offsets an event keyframe value. (E.G. Move, Zoom, etc)
Val Index is the value index of an event to set (E.G. 0 = X, 1 = Y, etc)
Offsets an event keyframe value by the object variable.
Offsets an event keyframe value using a math equation.
Animates an event offset in real time.
Takes an axis of the object and applies it to an event offset.
Forces vignette to follow the player. Can be good for moody dynamic levels.
Forces lens to follow the player.
Gets a color slot value and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets a hex code from a color slot and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets a float from a hex code and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets a hex code from a float and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets a hex color, modifies the HSV & opacity values and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets a list of colors, mixes them and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets two colors, interpolates them and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets two colors, adds all their color channels and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the colors of the visual object and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the RGBA color channels of the visual object and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the opacity values of the visual object and passes it to other modifiers.
Sets a custom theme. Overwrites interpolation. Leave the ID value empty to remove the custom theme.
Interpolates between two theme and sets it to the custom theme. Leave either ID value empty to remove the custom theme.
Adds a color to the object.
Adds a color to a group of objects.
Lerps the current object's color and the set color.
Lerps a group of object's color and the set color.
Adds color to the object based on distance from a player.
Lerps the current object's color and the set color to the object based on distance from a player.
Overrides the objects' current color with a custom hex color. Good for having an object always be consistently one color, regardless of theme.
Overrides a group of objects' current color with a custom hex color. Good for having an object always be consistently one color, regardless of theme.
Overrides the objects' current color with a custom RGBA color. Good for having an object always be consistently one color, regardless of theme.
Overrides a group of objects' current color with a custom RGBA color. Good for having an object always be consistently one color, regardless of theme.
Applies the objects' own color to a group of objects and interpolates based on any of the objects' own sequences.
Set the opacity of the object.
Set the opacity of a group of objects.
Copies the color of another object.
Applies the color of the object to a group of objects.
Animates the color of the object dynamically.
Animates the color of the object dynamically.
Moves, scales and rotates the mesh (shape) of the object around. Allows for custom gradient positioning.
Overrides the objects' current shape temporarily.
Modifies the polygon shape settings. The object has to be the custom polygon shape.
Modifies the polygon shape settings of an object group. The object has to be the custom polygon shape.
Sets the image of the image object, if the object is an image object.
Sets the image of a group of image objects, if the objects are an image object.
Sets the text of the text object, if the object is a text object.
Sets the text of a group of text objects, if the objects are a text object.
Add text to the end of the text object's current text, if the object is a text object.
Adds text to the end a group of text object's current text, if the objects are a text object.
Removes text at a the end of the text object's text, if the object is a text object.
Removes text at a the end of a group of text object's text, if the objects are a text object.
Removes text at a specific index of the text object's text, if the object is a text object.
Removes text at a specific index of a group of text object's text, if the objects are a text object.
Forces custom text formatting onto the text object, if the object is one.
Animates the text of the text object to be like a typewriter effect.
Swaps the 2D shape of the object to a 3D shape.
Changes the shape of the object to a sphere.
Gets an objects' animation value and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets an objects' animation value, evaluates math and passes it to other modifiers.
Animates the object in real-time.
Animates a group of objects in real-time.
Animates the object in real-time, then sends a signal to a group of objects that must have a requireSignal trigger when the animation is done.
Animates a group of objects in real-time, then sends a signal to a group of objects that must have a requireSignal trigger when the animation is done.
Animates the object in real-time.
Animates a group of objects in real-time.
Animates the object in real-time, then sends a signal to a group of objects that must have a requireSignal trigger when the animation is done.
Animates a group of objects in real-time, then sends a signal to a group of objects that must have a requireSignal trigger when the animation is done.
Applies an objects' animation to another.
Applies an objects' animation to another.
Applies an objects' animation to another.
Applies an objects' animation to another.
Applies an objects' animation to another.
Applies an objects' animation to another.
Copies the axis (E.G. position X, scale Y, etc) of another object and applies it to an axis of the current object with set limits and offsets. Basically, works like secondary parenting.

Copies the axis (E.G. position X, scale Y, etc) of another object and applies it to an axis of the current object with custom math evaluation (axis is the value being used and var is the object variable). Basically, works like secondary parenting.
Copies the axis (E.G. position X, scale Y, etc) of a group of objects and applies it to an axis of the current object with custom math evaluation. Basically, works like secondary parenting.
Copies the axis of a player and applies it to itself.
Makes a chain of objects act like the Legacy player tail.
Forces the object to have an attempt at gravity.
Forces a group of objects to have an attempt at gravity.
Trigger is active if an object's axis is equal to the modifier value.
Trigger is active if an object's axis is equal to or lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if an object's axis is equal to or greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if an object's axis is lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if an object's axis is greater than the modifier value.

Spawns a prefab from the internal prefabs list with custom offsets.
Inactive condition: Prefab that was spawned is killed. (Subject to change)

Spawns a prefab from the internal prefabs list with custom offsets and set to the objects position / scale / rotation.
Inactive condition: Prefab that was spawned is killed. (Subject to change)

Spawns a prefab from the internal prefabs list with custom offsets and set to the objects position / scale / rotation.
Inactive condition: Prefab that was spawned is killed. (Subject to change)
Spawns a prefab from the internal prefabs list and copies the data of another prefab object.
Spawns multiple prefabs from the internal prefabs list with custom offsets.
Spawns multiple prefabs from the internal prefabs list with custom offsets and set to the objects position / scale / rotation.
Spawns multiple prefabs from the internal prefabs list with custom offsets and set to the objects position / scale / rotation.
Spawns multiple prefabs from the internal prefabs list and copies the data of another prefab object.
Finds a group of objects and clears all prefab objects spawned from their modifiers.
Sets the time of the Prefab Objects' runtime.
Sets the active state of the Prefab Object that spawned this object.
Updates the Prefab Object that spawned this object.
Spawns a copy of the object and all of its children.

Spawns a copy of the object and all of its children.
Variables:
- currentPosX
- currentPosY
- currentPosZ
- currentScaX
- currentScaY
- currentRot
- currentTimeOffset
- cloneIndex
Reinitializes the object engine.
Reinitializes the level engine.
Reinitializes the object.
Reinitializes a group object of objects.
Temporarily sets the parent of the object until the object is updated or the level is reloaded. Set the Object Group field to empty if you want it to remove the parent instead.
Temporarily sets the parent of a group objects until the objects are updated or the level is reloaded. Leave "Parent Group To" empty to set the parent to this.
Temporarily desyncs the object and its children from the parent. It can be resynced via turning the toggle off.
Temporarily desyncs a group of objects and their children from their parents. They can be resynced via turning the toggle off.
Sets the current randomization seed and updates all animations accordingly.
Trigger is active if the objects' active state is true.
Trigger is active if the objects' custom active state is true.
Trigger is active if any of the group of objects are alive.
Trigger is active if any of the group of objects was spawned.
Gets the currently active checkpoint index and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the last checkpoint index in audio time and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the next checkpoint index in audio time and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the last marker index in audio time and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the last marker index in audio time and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the checkpoint count and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the marker count and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the time of a checkpoint at an index and passes it to other modifiers.
Gets the time of a marker at an index and passes it to other modifiers.
Creates a new checkpoint for players to respawn at when they all die. This modifier implements experimental features that haven't been added to the Checkpoint Editor yet, so use with caution.
Resets the currently active checkpoint either to the previous checkpoint, or the start checkpoint.
Sets the currently active checkpoint at an index.
Trigger is active if a matching checkpoint has been reached.
Trigger is active if a matching marker has been reached.
Loads a custom interface from the level folder.
Pauses the game and opens the pause menu.
Exits the currently open interface.
Quits the player to the main menu. Does not save player progress, so be aware of that.
Quits the player to the arcade. Does not save player progress, so be aware of that.
Sets the title of the Project Arrhythmia application.
Sets the current status to show in Discord.
Shows an editor notification. Good for debugging.
Trigger is active if fullscreen is on.
Sends a signal to a group of objects that must contain a requireSignal trigger modifier.
Runs a levels' modifier block. Good for compacting and reusing code.
Trigger is active if the modifier block it runs returns true.
Runs another objects modifier list. A timeline-friendly alternative to callModifierBlock.
Trigger is active if the modifier list it runs returns true. A timeline-friendly alternative to callModifierBlockTrigger.
Gets a tag at an index from the object and passes it to other modifiers.
Trigger is active if the object contains the specific tag.
Trigger is active if the modifier has been activated by a signalModifier modifier.
Trigger is active if random is greater than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if random is lesser than the modifier value.
Trigger is active if random is equal to the modifier value.
Gets a math evaluation and passes it to other modifiers.
Trigger is active if the first math equation is equal to the second math equation.
Trigger is active if the first math equation is equal to or lesser than the second math equation.
Trigger is active if the first math equation is equal to or greater than the second math equation.
Trigger is active if the first math equation is lesser than the second math equation.
Trigger is active if the first math equation is greater than the second math equation.
Trigger is active if the users' real date time is equal to the value.
Trigger is active if the users' real date time is equal to or lesser than the value.
Trigger is active if the users' real date time is equal to or greater than the value.
Trigger is active if the users' real date time is lesser than the value.
Trigger is active if the users' real date time is greater than the value.
Trigger is active if the user's LDM (Low Detail Mode) config is on. LDM can be found under Config Manager > Core > Level.
Trigger is active if the current player's username is equal to the modifier value you set.
Trigger is active if the current player's language is equal to the modifier value you set. Language can be found under Config Manager > Core > Settings.
Trigger is active if the user's Show Effects config is on. Show Effects can be found under Config Manager > Events > General.
Trigger is active if the user's Player & GUI Active config is on. Player & GUI Active can be found under Config Manager > Players > Game.
Trigger is active if the user's Show Intro config is on. Show Intro Can be found under Config Manager > Players > Game.
Documents are used for planning out a story, writing out extended notes, etc.
TODO planners are used for keeping track of what needs to be done and what has been done.
Character planners are used for planning out how a character is in your story / series.
Timeline planners are used for planning out the exact events in a series. The events can be linked to a level in your editor.
Schedule planners are used for planning around a specific date time.
Notes are used for noting down ideas, current projects, etc.
OST planners are used for planning out a soundtrack.

tooltips.desc: Adds a new item to the planner list.
tooltips.hint: Based on the current tab, a new planner item will be added. e.g. if you're looking at the document tab, a document planner will be added.

tooltips.desc: Pasted all copied planner items to the planner list.
tooltips.hint: Based on the current tab, the copied planner items will be pasted. e.g. if you're looking at the document tab, copied document planners will be pasted.
The folder that the planners should be loaded from. Can be right clicked to change the folder, or just typed in regularly.
The place the character comes from or currently resides.

tooltips.desc: Path to the level that represents the event.
tooltips.hint: The level at this path will be opened when the event is clicked. DISCLAIMER: The path will not change if the level is moved to a different folder.
Level: A gameplay oriented level. Cutscene: An animation oriented level. Story: An event with no associated level.

tooltips.desc: How the object should acknowledge the Low Detail Mode setting.
tooltips.hint: Normal: The normal spawn behavior, does not check for LDM setting. High Detail Only: Object only spawns if the LDM setting is off. Low Detail Only: Object only spawns if the LDM setting is on. No Spawn: Object doesn't spawn, regardless of LDM setting.

tooltips.desc: The normal spawn behavior, does not check for LDM setting.
Object only spawns if the LDM setting is off.
Object only spawns if the LDM setting is on.
Object doesn't spawn, regardless of LDM setting.

tooltips.hint: Right click to open the Color Picker.
